Ad Text:
Optus is an Australian telecommunications company, delivering more than 11 million services to our customers every day across mobile, broadband, and digital solutions.

Join our high performing Billing & Credit team within Group Finance, where we deliver secure onboarding and accurate billing experiences for Optus customers. As a Senior Portfolio Analyst, you'll help shape advanced analytics and reporting that support collections, recoveries and overall customer experience.

In this role, you'll develop insights and dashboards that influence key business decisions, improve operational efficiencies. You'll connect data across the credit lifecycle to uncover trends, support strategic initiatives, and drive continuous improvement, with strong exposure to senior leaders.

What you'll be doing

Design dashboards, reports, and scorecards that support Collections & Recoveries performance management across key metrics (business, financial, operational, customer), adherence to internal policies and regulatory requirements, and drive continuous improvement.
Generate accurate, meaningful insights by building forecasting models and connecting data across the customer lifecycle to highlight risks, opportunities, and clear business implications.
Partner with stakeholders to understand needs, lead performance discussions, manage deliverables, and translate complex analysis into clear, actionable business insights.
Align data solutions with enterprise reporting standards by partnering with data teams and sharing best practices through consulting and knowledge transfer.
Ensure data accuracy and governance by maintaining a clean reporting catalogue, data library, standard operating processes, enforcing consistent definitions and methods, and building strong data models.

What makes you perfect for the role?

Degree‑qualified with 5+ years' experience in data analytics, integration, and visualisation.
Strong technical skills across SQL, data modelling, Excel/VBA, and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Cognos, Alteryx).
Solid understanding of collections and recoveries processes, reporting, and customer journeys.
High proficiency in Excel (financial analysis and modelling), PowerPoint, and complex database work.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify complex insights for senior stakeholders.

Optus is a place where we let you do you. We offer a range of benefits including:

Competitive remuneration and employee discounts. Make life easier (and more affordable) with $80 monthly credit and 25% off Optus products and unique shopping discounts with our retail partners.
Flexible working arrangements with opportunities to work three days in the office, two days remote or home.
Vibrant and collaborative office campus that includes cafes, convenience store, chill out zones, GP, post office, gym and on-site childcare centre.
Competitive leave policies, including additional 'Connected' days to focus on culture, family, health, community, or whatever's important to you.
We support growing families with inclusive, carer-neutral paid Parental Leave of up to 16 weeks.
Direct your own development and build future-ready skills with Optus U's industry-focused micro-credentials, developed with La Trobe and Macquarie Universities.
Build meaningful connections through employee-led networks and diversity initiatives including Culture Connect, Elevate Women, Disability Network and Express Yourself (LGBTQIA+).
Put your wellbeing first with free access to counselling and support services, 24/7 — in-person, by phone, SMS, or video.

About the role

As a Business Process Analyst in our Digital Transformation Office, you’ll play a critical role in making life easier for our front line leaders.  You will partner closely with our Child, Youth & Family (CYF) and Disability & Mental Health (DMH) practice teams to deeply understand how frontline work really happens — the pressures, the complexity, the workarounds, and the moments that matter to carers and clients. Your purpose will be to simplify and streamline core practice processes so our carers and front line leaders and employees can spend more time in meaningful connection with the people we support, and less time wrestling with paperwork, duplication, and inefficient workflows.

This is a full‑time maximum‑term contract through to June 2027 that can be located anywhere in Australia, where you have full flexibility to work from home or one of our offices with some travel required for in person collaboration. 

Key Responsibilities

Work in partnership with CYF and DMH teams to understand real‑world workflows.
Lead the discovery, mapping and analysis of Level 2 and Level 3 processes, making complex practice operations understandable for decision‑makers.
Translate current states into clear, visual, standardised workflows.
Identify opportunities for simplification, standardisation, and waste reduction.
Highlight and articulate the “points of transformation” — the exact moments where the process becomes easier, faster, or safer.
Redesign future‑state workflows using Lean, continuous improvement and human‑centred design approaches.
Ensure processes are practical, compliant, and reflect the lived reality of CYF and DMH practice.
Identify and define measurable benefits across efficiency, quality, client experience and workforce experience.
Support benefits tracking, benefits realisation, and clear linkage between improvements and frontline outcomes.
Communicate process concepts in simple, accessible language.
Provide inputs for training, change narratives, operating models and system requirements.
Facilitate cross‑functional alignment across business, ICT and governance groups.

Skills & Experience

Demonstrated experience in process analysis, optimisation or business improvement in complex, highly regulated environments.
Proven capability mapping and redesigning Level 2 and Level 3 processes using Lean Six Sigma or similar frameworks.
Ability to identify inefficiencies, risks, and real‑world pain points — even when they’re not explicitly stated.
Strong facilitation skills, with experience engaging frontline practitioners, leaders and technical teams (most of which will be online).
Excellent communication skills, able to translate complex process logic into clear, plain‑English insights for various stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills with experience quantifying benefits and demonstrating real, measurable improvements.
High‑quality documentation skills using tools such as Visio, Miro or Lucidchart.
Experience working collaboratively with ICT, Business Analysts, designers or architects to translate process changes into system or implementation impacts.

Successful candidates will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check.

Benefits

Join a team that encourages innovative thinking
Challenging position working in a modern, best practice ICT environment
Excellent tax benefits & monthly rostered days off

How to Apply

Include your resume and cover letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries relating to the position, contact recruitment@lwb.org.au Candidates with disabilities who require adjustments to the recruitment process or the application form in an alternate format can visit https://www.lwb.org.au/careers/ for information on our access and inclusion work and how to contact us directly.

Applications close at midnight AEDT 1 March 2026.

This 12-month fixed term contract role supports senior leaders across a large national property portfolio by turning complex data into clear commercial insight. You’ll work at the intersection of property, finance and procurement, helping the business understand where money is going, why it’s moving, and what actions make sense.

This is not a pure data or reporting role. Analytics and modelling are tools, commercial judgement is the core.

What you’ll do

· Analyse property, finance and procurement data to identify cost drivers, recovery gaps and optimisation opportunities

· Support national procurement initiatives, validating data accuracy and commercial alignment to RFP requirements

· Review contracts and supplier spend to identify pricing or structural misalignment

· Build clear, decision-focused dashboards and models (Power BI / Excel)

· Develop scenario analysis to support budgeting, cost recovery and investment decisions

· Translate complex information into practical insights for senior stakeholders

About you

· Strong problem-solver from a commercial property environment

· Comfortable working with large, imperfect datasets and ambiguity

· Experience using analytics and reporting tools to enable decisions, not just produce reports

· Confident communicator who can explain the why, not just the numbers

Experience & qualifications

· Typically 6–10+ years in a commercial, portfolio or property analyst role

· Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Property, or similar (or equivalent experience)

· Professional qualifications beneficial but not essential

Real ownership and trust — you’re empowered to make decisions and backed to deliver outcomes that matter

Flexibility that actually works — shape your workday, workspace and benefits to suit how you perform best

Meaningful growth — access learning, development and career opportunities aligned to your goals

Wellbeing comes first — strong mental health, family and personal support so you can perform at your best

Competitive, people-first benefits — paid parental leave, additional personal leave, flexible work options and performance incentives

A culture that keeps it real — high-performing, approachable, and genuinely connected to community and each other

About ROLLER

ROLLER isn’t your average SaaS company. We operate globally across 30+ countries, powering millions of real-world experiences in the leisure and attractions industry. What we build doesn’t just live on a screen. It shows up in busy venues, peak weekends, and unforgettable moments for guests.

Our mission is simple but ambitious: help operators run better businesses while creating great guest experiences. That means solving complex, real-world problems across ticketing, point of sale, self-service, memberships, kiosks, and digital waivers, all at meaningful scale.

Just as importantly, it’s the people. We’re a team of 300+ smart, grounded, and genuinely passionate humans working across the globe. We care about quality, ownership, and doing work we’re proud of, without taking ourselves too seriously.

We’re growing fast, aiming high, and building something that matters. If you want to work on real problems, with real customers, alongside people who care deeply about their craft and impact, ROLLER is a great place to do it.




About the Role

We’re looking for a curious, commercially minded Data Analyst to join our Venue Operations Tribe. This role partners closely with Product Managers and tribe leadership to help us understand how venues use ROLLER day-to-day, which features create real value for different venue “archetypes”, and how we can drive smarter product and adoption decisions with evidence and not guesswork.

You’ll work across product usage, feature availability/adoption, and venue performance insights, connecting patterns in the data to decisions that improve outcomes for customers and the business.

This role is based in Melbourne with a hybrid working model from our South Melbourne office.




Why You'll Enjoy This Role

🚀 Real Scale, Real Momentum - If you want your judgment to matter, this is the place. ROLLER is a global, rapidly scaling SaaS business backed by Insight Partners. In 2025, we powered 90 million guest experiences across those 35 countries and we’re growing fast towards 1 billion experiences a year.

📈 Your Work Will Change Real Decisions - Your analysis will directly influence roadmap bets, feature investments, and adoption strategy. This isn’t reporting for reporting’s sake - your work will shape what we build and why.

🤝 Work Side-by-Side With Product Leaders - You’ll partner closely with PMs and tribe leadership - helping frame sharper questions, challenge assumptions, and turn data into direction. You won’t be operating at arm’s length.

🔎 Solve Real Product Analytics Problems - From event streams and audit logs to feature journeys and venue archetypes, you’ll dig into behavioural data to understand how customers actually use ROLLER - not just whether a KPI moved.




Why You Want To Work With Us!

❤️ Loved by Customers - ROLLER is consistently highly rated on Capterra and G2, and trusted by leading operators worldwide. That doesn’t happen by accident. Customer obsession isn’t a value on a wall here, it’s embedded in how we prioritise, build, and measure success.

🏆 A Great Place People Choose to Stay - We’ve been Great Place to Work certified across multiple regions for several years running. That reflects a culture that values trust, autonomy, and growth, and an environment where high standards and psychological safety coexist.

💸 Competitive Package & Real Career Growth - We offer competitive compensation and benefits aligned to the level of ownership we expect. As ROLLER scales, so do the opportunities. People grow here by taking on bigger problems, broader scope, and greater responsibility. Progression is driven by impact and capability, not tenure, and strong performance is recognised and rewarded.




What You'll Do

Drive product and adoption insights: Analyse feature availability, activation and usage to understand what’s working, for who, and why.

Build venue archetypes & playbooks: Identify venue “shapes” (segments/archetypes) that get value from different features and help build data-backed playbooks to nudge the right venues to the right capabilities.

Deep-dive event, audit and activity logs: Go beyond simple “feature on/off” signals, use event streams and audit logs to understand behaviours, journeys, and usage patterns.

Support performance-oriented analysis: Help uncover what “great” looks like, identifying high-performing venues and the behaviours that correlate with exceptional operational outcomes, then surface insights we can share broadly.

Create dashboards & reporting in our BI environment: Build clear, trusted reporting and dashboards (primarily in Looker) that help PMs move quickly and confidently.

Turn analysis into decisions: Provide recommendations to influence product decisions, balancing speed vs accuracy based on the decision context and clearly communicating assumptions/limitations.

Partner cross-functionally: Collaborate with PMs, tribe leadership, and occasionally data/engineering counterparts to improve data quality, expand what’s available in Looker, and define better questions upstream.




About You

Experience using at least one modern BI tool (Looker, Tableau, or Power BI) and can ramp into a new tool quickly.

Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with imperfect/real-world data, knowing when something is “good enough” vs when accuracy is critical.

Product analytics experience (feature adoption, funnels/journeys, engagement/retention patterns).
